events.title: CA Senate: AI Safety Bill SB 1047 Implementation Hearing
events.summary: State hearing on implementing SB 1047 AI safety requirements. Y Combinator and other tech leaders have raised concerns about compliance costs for startups and potential chilling effect on AI innovation in California.
events.recommended_action: Testify AGAINST overly restrictive AI regulations. Sign up for public comment at 9:30am and share how SB 1047 compliance costs would hurt YC startups.

events.title: Board of Supervisors: Housing Approval Streamlining Act
events.summary: Vote on reducing permit approval times from 18 months to 6 months for housing projects. Aligns with YIMBY goals to accelerate housing construction and address the affordability crisis.
events.recommended_action: Email your Supervisor to vote YES on the Streamlining Act. Call (415) 554-5184 before Thursday to register your support.

events.title: Police Commission: SFPD Staffing & Recruitment Plan
events.summary: Commission vote on plan to hire 300 new officers over 3 years and improve retention. Addresses understaffing that has impacted response times in SoMa and downtown tech corridors.
events.recommended_action: Attend the 5pm hearing and speak in SUPPORT of the staffing plan during public comment. Mention response time concerns in your neighborhood.

events.title: YC Future Founders Program: Apply Now
events.summary: Y Combinator is accepting applications for the Future Founders program. Get $500K in funding, mentorship from top founders, and access to the YC network. Perfect for technical founders building in AI, climate, or govtech.
events.recommended_action: Apply to YC before the March 1st deadline. Prepare your 1-minute video and complete the application at ycombinator.com/apply.

events.title: Budget Committee: Startup Tax Incentive Extension
events.summary: Hearing on extending tax incentives for early-stage startups with under $5M revenue. Current relief expires in June. Failure to extend could accelerate tech company relocations to Austin and Miami.
events.recommended_action: Submit written testimony supporting the tax extension by Feb 21st. Email budget.committee@sfgov.org with examples of startups that would benefit.

events.title: GoSolarSF: 30% Tax Credit Expires Dec 31
events.summary: California's 30% solar tax credit expires this year. SF homeowners can save $8,000-$15,000 on installation. The GoSolarSF program offers additional rebates for qualifying residents.
events.recommended_action: Get a free solar assessment at GoSolarSF.org. Lock in your 30% federal tax credit before it drops to 26% next year.

events.title: HSH Oversight Hearing: Homelessness Spending Audit
events.summary: Controller's audit of $1.1B annual homelessness spending. Report examines why visible homelessness remains high despite record budgets. Includes recommendations for outcome-based metrics.
events.recommended_action: Attend the 1pm hearing and demand outcome-based metrics. Ask why $1.1B hasn't reduced visible homelessness in SoMa and downtown.

events.title: Planning Commission: CEQA Exemption for Transit-Adjacent Housing
events.summary: Vote to exempt housing within 1/2 mile of transit from lengthy CEQA review. Could cut 12-18 months from approval timeline. Opposed by some neighborhood groups citing environmental concerns.
events.location: SF Planning Dept, 49 South Van Ness
events.recommended_action: Sign up to speak at the 1pm hearing in SUPPORT of CEQA reform. Emphasize that transit-adjacent housing reduces car dependence and IS environmentally friendly.

events.title: CPUC Hearing: Autonomous Vehicle Expansion in SF
events.summary: Public comment session on expanding Waymo and Cruise operating hours and zones. Tech industry supports expansion while some residents cite safety concerns after recent incidents.
events.recommended_action: Submit written comment SUPPORTING AV expansion at cpuc.ca.gov/av-comments by March 10th. Cite safety data showing AVs have fewer accidents per mile than human drivers.

events.title: DA Policy Forum: Retail Theft & Prosecution Standards
events.summary: DA Brooke Jenkins presenting updated prosecution guidelines for retail theft and property crimes. Part of efforts to address concerns from downtown businesses about repeat offenders.
events.recommended_action: Attend the 6pm forum and voice SUPPORT for stricter prosecution of repeat offenders. Share how retail theft affects businesses you frequent or invest in.

events.title: Mayor's Office: Downtown Office-to-Housing Conversion Incentives
events.summary: Announcement of new incentives to convert vacant downtown office buildings to housing. Addresses 30% office vacancy rate while adding housing supply. Tax breaks and expedited permits included.
events.recommended_action: Tweet SUPPORT for office-to-housing conversions and tag @LondonBreed. Rally tech leaders to publicly endorse the incentive program.

events.title: Board Resolution: Support Federal Startup Visa Program
events.summary: Resolution urging Congress to create dedicated startup visa for international founders. SF has lost founders to Canada's startup visa program. Tech leaders invited to testify.
events.recommended_action: Testify at the 2pm hearing about YC founders lost to Canada's visa program. Bring specific examples of international founders who had to relocate.

match_explanation: Showing civic events matching your interests in AI policy, housing development, public safety, and startup-friendly policies in San Francisco.
